dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Alright. Phoebe?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, okay. If I were omnipotent for a day, I would want, um, world peace, no more hunger, good things for the rain-forest...And bigger boobs!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, see.. you took mine. Chandler, what about you?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Uh, if I were omnipotent for a day, I'd.. make myself omnipotent forever.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: See, there's always one guy. (Mocking) "If I had a wish, I'd wish for three more wishes." (Joey enters.)

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Hey Joey. Hi. Hey, buddy.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey, Joey, what would you do if you were omnipotent?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Probably kill myself!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: ..Excuse me?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, if Little Joey's dead, then I got no reason to live!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Joey, uh- OM nipotent.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You are ? Ross, I'm sorry..

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, Ross and Monica are watching Phoebe
sleep.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: How does she do that?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I cannot sleep in a public place.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Would you look at her? She is so peaceful.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (waking and startling them) Oh! What what what! ...Hi.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: It's okay, y'know, you just nodded off again.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What's going on with you?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I got no sleep last night!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Why?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: My grandmother has this new boyfriend, and they're both kind of insecure in bed. Oh, and deaf. So they're constantly, like, having to reassure each other that they're having a good time. You have no idea how loud they are!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, if you want, you can stay with Rachel and me tonight.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Thanks.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: ...Ninety-five, ninety-six, ninety-seven. See, I told you! Less than a hundred steps from our place to here.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You got waaaay too much free time.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (to Ross) Hey! Here's the birthday boy! Ross,

dialogue.speaker: CHECK IT OUT
dialogue.text: hockey tickets, Rangers-Penguins, tonight at the Garden, and we're taking you.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Happy birthday, pal!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: We love you, man. (Kisses Ross)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Funny, my birthday was seven months ago.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: So?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: So, I'm guessing you had an extra ticket and couldn't decide which one of you got to bring a date?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, aren't we Mr. "The glass is half empty."

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh my God, oh- is today the twentieth, October twentieth?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, I was hoping you wouldn't remember.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ohhh.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What's wrong with the twentieth?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Eleven days before Halloween.. all the good costumes are gone?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Today's the day Carol and I first.. consummated our physical relationship. (Joey is puzzled.) Sex. ..You know what, I-I'd better pass on the game. I think I'm just gonna go home and think about my ex-wife and her lesbian lover.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: The hell with hockey, let's all do that!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (trying to stop Ross leaving) C'mon, Ross! You, me, Joey, ice, guys' night out, c'mon, whaddya say, big guy, (Pretending to punch him in the stomach.) Huh? Huh? Huh?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What are you doing?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (stops) I have no idea.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: C'mon, Ross!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Alright, alright, maybe it'll take my mind off it. Do you promise to buy me a big thumb finger?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You got it.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Look-look-look-look-look, my first pay check! Look at the window, there's my name! Hi, me!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I remember the day I got my first pay check. There was a cave in in one of the mines, and eight people were killed.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Wow, you worked in a mine?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I worked in a Dairy Queen , why?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: God, isn't this exciting? I earned this. I wiped tables for it, I steamed milk for it, and it was totally—(opens envelope)—not worth it. Who's FICA? Why's he getting all my money? I mean, what- Chandler, look at that.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (looking) Oh, this is not that bad.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, you're fine, yeah, for a first job.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You can totally, totally live on this.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah, yeah.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, by the way, great service tonight.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Oh! Yeah!

dialogue.speaker: GUYS
dialogue.text: Hockey! (They go to leave but are blocked by three of Rachel's friends, Leslie, Kiki, and Joanne. The guys pause to stare at them.) Hockey! Hockey. (The guys.)

dialogue.speaker: LESLIE
dialogue.text: (looking around) Rachel?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh my God! (Rachel, Leslie, Kiki, and Joanne all scream and hug each other.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (to Phoebe) I swear I've seen birds do this on Wild Kingdom .

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What are you guys doing here?

dialogue.speaker: KIKI
dialogue.text: Well, we were in the city shopping, and your mom said you work here, aaand it's true!

dialogue.speaker: JOANNE
dialogue.text: Look at you in the apron. You look like you're in a play.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (to a pregnant Leslie) Look at you, you are so big I can't believe it!

dialogue.speaker: LESLIE
dialogue.text: I know. I know! I'm a duplex.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (to Joanne) So what's going on with you?

dialogue.speaker: JOANNE
dialogue.text: Well, guess who my dad's making partner in his firm? (She points to herself and they all scream again.)

dialogue.speaker: KIKI
dialogue.text: And while we're on the subject of news.. (She holds up here finger to show off her engagement ring and they all scream again.)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (to Monica) Look, look, I have elbows! (They scream.)

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: A Street, Chandler and Joey are kicking a can to
each other.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: ...Poulet passes it up to Leetch! (Passes it to Joey.)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Leetch spots Messier in the crease- there's the pass! (He kicks it to Ross, but Ross is staring into a shop window.)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: We'll take a brief time out while Messier stops to look at some women's shoes.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Carol was wearing boots just like those the night that we- we first- y'know. Fact, she, uh- she never took'em off, 'cause we-we- (off Chandler's look) Sorry. Sorry.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Peach pit.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes, Bunny?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (points) Peach pit. That night we, uh- we had-

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: -Peaches?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Actually, nectarines, but basically...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (to Joey) Could've been a peach.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Then, uh, then we got dressed, and I-I... I walked her to the- (looks up, realises, and points) -the bus stop... I'm fine.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, that woman's got an ass like Carol's! (They turn to stare at him.) What? Thought we were trying to find stuff.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, Rachel, Lesile, Kiki, and Joanne are
talking.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: So c'mon, you guys, tell me all the dirt!

dialogue.speaker: KIKI
dialogue.text: Well, the biggest news is still you dumping Barry at the altar!

dialogue.speaker: JOANNE
dialogue.text: Alright. Let's talk reality for a second.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: JOANNE
dialogue.text: When are you coming home?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What? Guys, I'm not.

dialogue.speaker: JOANNE
dialogue.text: C'mon, this is us.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I'm not! This is what I'm doing now. I've got this job-

dialogue.speaker: KIKI
dialogue.text: Waitressing?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay, I'm not just waitressing. I'm.. I, um... I write the specials on the specials board, and, uh... and I, uh... I take the uh dead flowers out of the vase... Oh, and, um, sometimes Artelle lets me put the little chocolate blobbies on the cookies.

dialogue.speaker: LESLIE
dialogue.text: Well. Your mom didn't tell us about the blobbies.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe and Monica are in
pajamas and Monica is making something in the blender as Rachel enters.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey, Rach. How was it with your friends? (She and Phoebe scream.) Okay! How would you like some Tiki Death Punch? (She pours the contents of the blender into some glasses.)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What's that?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Weeeell, it's rum, and-

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay. (Grabs the blender and starts to drink.)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: We thought since Phoebe was staying over tonight we'd have kinda like a slumber party thing. We got some trashy magazines, we got cookie dough, we got Twister ... (The phone rings and Monica answers it.)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ooh! Ooh! And I brought Operation ! But, um, I lost the tweezers, so we can't operate. But we can prep the guy!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Uh, Rach, it's the Visa card people.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, God, ask them what they want.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (on phone) Could you please tell me what this is in reference to? (Listens) Yes, hold on. (To Rachel) Um, they say there's been some unusual activity on your account.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: But I haven't used my card in weeks!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: That is the unusual activity. Look, they just wanna see if you're okay.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: They wanna know if I'm okay. Okay.. they wanna know if I'm okay, okay, let's see. Well, let's see, the FICA guys took all my money, everyone I know is either getting married, or getting promoted, or getting pregnant, and I'm getting coffee! And it's not even for me! So if that sounds like I'm okay, okay, then you can tell them I'm okay, okay?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (pauses then on the phone) Uh- Rachel has left the building, can you call back?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Alright, c'mon! (Miserably) Let's play Twister !

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Madison Square Garden , the guys are trying
to find their seats.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (squeezing past people) Sorry, sorry... Uh-oh.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What? There was ice there that night with Carol? Plastic seats? Four thousand angry Pittsburgh fans?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, actually I was just saying it looks like we're not sitting together. But now you mention it, there was ice there that night... It was the first frost...

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: C'mon, sit. Just sit down, sit.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, they're all hanging out in the
living room.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You should feel great about yourself! You're doing this amazing independence thing!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Monica, what is so amazing? I gave up, like, everything. And for what?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: You are just like Jack.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: ...Jack from downstairs?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, Jack and the Beanstalk.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Ah, the other Jack.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, right! See, he gave up something, but then he got those magic beans. And then he woke up, and there was this, this big plant outside his window, full of possibilities and stuff.. And he lived in a village, and you live in the Village..

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay, but Pheebs, Pheebs, Jack gave up a cow, I gave up an orthodontist. Okay, I-I-I know, I know I didn't love him-

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, see, Jack did love the cow.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: But see, it was a plan. Y'know, it was clear. It was figured out, and now everything's just kinda like...

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Floopy?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: So what, you're not the only one. I mean, half the time we don't know where we're going. You've just gotta figure at some point it's all gonna come together, and it's just gonna be... un-floopy.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, like that's a word.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay, but Monica, what if- what if it doesn't come together?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: ...Pheebs?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, well... 'cause.... you just... I don't like this question.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay, see, see, you guys, what if we don't get magic beans? I mean, what if all we've got are.. beans?

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Madison Square Garden , the guys are
watching the game.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Get him! GET HIM! Get him! Get- YESSS! Not laughing now, are ya pal!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (to Ross) See buddy, that's all you need, a bunch of toothless guys hitting each other with sticks.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Pass it! Pass it!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: He's open!

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Shoot! Shoot! Shoot!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey, look, we're on that TV thing!

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: An Emergency Room, Chandler and Joey are leading
Ross in.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (to the receptionist)'Scuse me.

dialogue.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogue.text: (holds up her hand—she is on the phone) It says to call this number if you're not completely satisfied with this candy bar. Well, I'm not completely satisfied.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Listen, it's kind of an emergency. Well, I guess you know that, or we'd be in the predicament room. (The receptionist glares at him.)

dialogue.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogue.text: (on phone) Hold on. (To Chandler) Fill these out, sit over there. (Tosses him some forms.)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (jumping to his feet) Look, I don't wanna make any trouble, okay, but I'm in a lot of pain here, alright? My face is dented .

dialogue.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogue.text: Well, you'll have to wait your turn.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, how long do you think it'll be?

dialogue.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogue.text: (sarcastic) Any minute now.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey, this- (she gives him a look and the guys back off) Heyy...

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the slumber party continues.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I'm so sorry, you guys. I didn't mean to bring you down.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No, you were right. I don't have a plan. (There's a knock on the door.)

dialogue.speaker: PIZZA GUY
dialogue.text: (yelling from outside) Pizza guy!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Thank God. Food. (She goes to answer the door.)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Phoebe?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Do you have a plan?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I don't even have a 'pl'.

dialogue.speaker: PIZZA GUY
dialogue.text: Hi, one, uh, mushroom, green pepper and onion?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (miserably) No, no, that's not what we ordered... We ordered a fat-free crust with extra cheese.

dialogue.speaker: PIZZA GUY
dialogue.text: Wait, you're not 'G.Stephanopoulos?' Man, my dad's gonna kill me!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (leaping off of the couch and runs up) Wait! Did you say 'G.Stephanopoulos?'

dialogue.speaker: PIZZA GUY
dialogue.text: Yeah. This one goes across the street, I must have given him yours. Oh, bonehead, bonehead!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Wait, was this a-a small mediterranean guy with curiously intelligent good looks?

dialogue.speaker: PIZZA GUY
dialogue.text: Yeah, that sounds about right.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Was he wearing a stunning blue suit?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: And-and a power tie?

dialogue.speaker: PIZZA GUY
dialogue.text: No, pretty much just a towel.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (staggered) Oh God.

dialogue.speaker: PIZZA GUY
dialogue.text: So you guys want me to take this back?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Are you nuts?! We've got George Stephanopoulos' pizza! (Rachel pays him, Monica grabs some binoculars, and runs to the window.)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Uh, Pheebs? Who's George Snuffalopagus?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Big Bird's friend.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I see pizza!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, I wanna see! Lemme see! Lemme see! (She runs up and takes the binoculars.)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hello? Who are we spying on?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: White House adviser? Clinton's campaign guy? The one with the great hair, sexy smile, really cute butt?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, him, the little guy? Oh, I love him!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ooh, wait.. wait, I see a woman.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Please tell me it's his mother.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Definitely not his mother.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, no...

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, wait, she's walking across the floor.. she's walking.. she's walking.. she's going for the pizza- (Yelling) Hey, that's not for you, bitch! (Phoebe covers her mouth with her hand walks away from the window.)

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: The Emergency Room, Joey is miming hockey pucks
kitting foreheads.  Chandler realises it's getting tense and goes to the receptionist
again.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Excuse me, look, we've been here for over an hour, and a lot of people less sick than my friend have gone in. I mean, that guy with the toe thing? Who's he sleeping with? (She slides the gladd panel over and Chandler talks through it in a loud voice.) Oh, c'mon Dora, don't be mad... I know we both said some things we didn't mean, but that doesn't mean we still don't love each other. (To the waiting room.) Y'know, I feel like I've lost her.. (She slides the panel back, he turns, and it takes him by surprise.) Ba-!

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the girls are all out on the
balcony.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Light still out?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh. Maybe they're- napping.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh please, they're having sex.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA AND PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Shut up!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: So, whaddya think George is like?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I think he's shy.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah. I think you have to draw him out. And then- when you do- he's a preppy animal.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: The Emergency Room, Ross is still going on about
his first night with Carol.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I remember the moonlight coming through the window- and her face had the most incredible glow.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes, the moon, the glow, the magical feeling, you did this part- Could I get some painkillers over here, please?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: He's right, enough, already. What is the big deal about today? So you slept with her for the first time, so what? You slept with her for seven years after that.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Look, it's just a little more complicated...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, what? What? What is it? That she left you? That she likes women? That she left you for another woman that likes women?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Little louder, okay, I think there's a man on the twelfth floor in a coma that didn't quite hear you...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Then what?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: My first time with Carol was... (He mumbles the last part)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: It was my first time .

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: With Carol? (Ross gives him a look.) Oh.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: So in your whole life, you've only been with one—(He gets a look too)—oh.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Whoah, boy, hockey was a big mistake! There was a whole bunch of stuff we could've done tonight!

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the girls are still out on the
balcony.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay. Okay, I got one. Do you remember that vegetarian pate that I made that you loved so much?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Uh-huh.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, unless goose is a vegetable...ha haaaah!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh! Oh! Oh! Okay, fine, fine. Now I don't feel so bad about sleeping with Jason Hurley.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What?! You slept with Jason?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: You'd already broken up.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: How long?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: A couple hours.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, that's nice!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay, okay, okay, I got one! (She sits up and the cushion she was leaning against falls off of the balcony.) Anyway- The valentine Tommy Rollerson left in your locker was really from me.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Excuse me?!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hello? Like he was really gonna send you one? (To Phoebe) She was a big girl .

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Really. Well, at least 'big girls' don't pee in their pants in seventh grade!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I was laughing! You made me laugh! (Monica and Rachel start to squabble)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: There he is! There he is!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Where?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Right- where we've been looking all night!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: He is so cute!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, George, baby, drop the towel!

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Yeah, drop it! Drop the towel! Please drop the (pause) wowww.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The Emergency Room, Ross is absent.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Man. Can you believe he's only had sex with one woman?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I think it's great. Y'know, it's sweet, it's romantic...

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Really?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No, you kidding? The guy's a freak.. (Ross enters off camera)

dialogue.speaker: BOTH
dialogue.text: Hey, buddy.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hi. (He is wearing a piece of steel bandaged to his nose. He tosses some forms onto reception desk.)

dialogue.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogue.text: (sarcastic) Oh, that's attractive.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, I thought you were great in Silence of the Lambs. Oh come on, admit it! All things considered, you had fun tonight.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Fun? Where was the fun? Tell me specifically, which part was the fun part? Where's my puck?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, ah- the kid has it.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: The kid...? (To the kid) Excuse me, uh, that's, that's my puck.

dialogue.speaker: KID
dialogue.text: I found it. Finders keepers, losers weepers. (Ross looks at Chandler for help.)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You gotta do it, man.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (to the kid) Oh yeah? Well, I'm rubber, you're glue, whatever—(to Chandler)—can't do it. (to the kid) Listen, uh- gimme back my puck.

dialogue.speaker: KID
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: 'Yes', how about. C'mere. Gimme!

dialogue.speaker: KID
dialogue.text: No! No! (They start to fight over it.)

dialogue.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogue.text: Hey! Hey! No rough holding in my ER!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (tries to snatch it from the kid) GIVE ME MY PUCK!! (but it files out of his grasp and knocks out the receptionist)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: ...Now that was fun.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Joey and the girls are playing
twister.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (Doing the spinning) Okay,

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Right foot red.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Could've played Monopoly , but nooooo.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Thanks. (The guy nods and leaves)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay,

dialogue.speaker: PHEEBS
dialogue.text: Right hand blue. (Phoebe has to bend over.)Good. (Joey stares at her butt appreciatively)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hello? Oh, uh, Rachel, it's the Visa card people.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, okay. Will you take my place?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Alright. (on phone) Yes, this is Rachel.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Nooo! (She grabs the phone and Chandler takes her place on the mat.) (On phone) Hello? (Listens) Oh, yeah, no, I know, I-I haven't been using it much. (Listens) Oh, well, thanks, but, I'm okay, really.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Green. To the green.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (on phone) I've got magic beans. (Listens) Never-never mind.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: To the left, to the left- aww! (They all collapse)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (on phone) Ohhh... I'm fine.
